title: Ticket #6638: 49ec2-instance.sh does not retry or shutdown node on failures
description:
Heath reports that when starting enough instances, the 49ec2-instance.sh script will trigger Amazon's DoS defenses: 

I've been deploying 100 instances at a time in
10-20 minute intervals.  One thing I notice on 1% of the instances is that
the condor-annex-ec2 service fails with a RequestLimitExceeded error from
AWS and just gives up.  This causes the instance to not join the pool and
just sit there.

Apr 02 20:41:49 ip-172-31-23-203.us-east-2.compute.internal
condor-annex-ec2[1059]: Note: Forwarding request to 'systemctl is-enabled
condor.service'.
Apr 02 20:41:49 ip-172-31-23-203.us-east-2.compute.internal
condor-annex-ec2[1059]: enabled
Apr 02 20:42:00 ip-172-31-23-203.us-east-2.compute.internal
condor-annex-ec2[1059]: Configuring HTCondor to be an EC2 annex: waiting for
Spot Fleet to tag me: OK
Apr 02 20:42:00 ip-172-31-23-203.us-east-2.compute.internal
condor-annex-ec2[1059]: An error occurred (RequestLimitExceeded) when
calling the DescribeSpotFleetRequests o...ceeded.
Apr 02 20:42:02 ip-172-31-23-203.us-east-2.compute.internal
condor-annex-ec2[1059]: failed!

  • The script should include several random seconds of splay on start-up to help avoid this problem.
  • The script should retry (with random and exponential back-off).
  • The script should [probably] just shut the machine down if it fails. Think about this carefully, since it will make debugging nightmare.
